widgets_values: Depending on the latent upscaler model used, it can increase either spatial or temporal resolution, without moving to/from pixel space.

If you are not constrained in VRAM, run 1x1 tile starting from step 18 
If you are constrained in your available VRAM, run 2x2 tiles and use somewhat lower noies levels, starting from step 23.

Overlap decides how many of the last frames in the input video are used to condition the new video generation. The total number of frames generated is frame_overlap + num_new_frames, and then the new video and the previous video are fused by this node and the full extended video is returned.

nodes.title: CLIP Text Encode (Positive Prompt)
widgets_values: battleship flying at high speed through a vast, dark, and dystopian cityscape inspired by The Matrix. Towering brutalist skyscrapers with flickering neon signs loom overhead. Dense fog clings to the streets below, while glowing green data streams course along building edges. Occasional lightning flashes illuminate cybernetic towers. The atmosphere is oppressive and mechanical. The drone navigates past mechanical structures, cables suspended between towers, and security drones hovering in the distance. Ambient industrial noise fills the air, accompanied by eerie green ambient lighting. The cinematic perspective captures intense and moody visuals, with continuous motion providing a seamless aerial tour. The scene embodies cyberpunk aesthetics, grim digital decay, and high fidelity, rendered in ultra detail with a cinematic camera path at 4K resolution and 24fps.
Best use descriptive prompt, but you can even leave it empty in i2v case.

nodes.title: CLIP Text Encode (Negative Prompt)
widgets_values: low quality, worst quality, deformed, distorted, disfigured, motion smear, motion artifacts, fused fingers, bad anatomy, weird hand, ugly, face out of camera shot,

Framerate can be adjusted, just make sure you are using the same framerate in your VideoCombine node to see proper playback.

60FPS = Lower quality, more motion
24 FPS = Higher quality, less motion
Presets override the values inside ðŸ…›ðŸ…£ðŸ…§ STG Guider Advanced node.

We generate at a base resolution of 768x512.
The video will be upscaled later to FHD.

The Advanced STG Guider dynamically controls the diffusion model's denoising process by mapping sigma values to specific configuration parameters (CFG scale, STG scale/rescale factors, and attention layer skipping patterns), enabling precise control at different denoising stages independently of step numbers while supporting additional techniques like CFG-Zero rescaling and threshold-based noise prediction zeroing.

crop decides if the conditioning image(s) is center-cropped or resized by stretching 

crf and blur are preprocessing parameters for conditioning image(s) to make them look more like video frames, which helps with the dynamicity of the generated video
